summary: Jane's Addiction is an American rock band that formed in Los Angeles in 1985. The band has had an on-again, off-again history, with various lineup changes over the years. Their original lineup consisted of singer Perry Farrell, guitarist Dave Navarro, drummer Stephen Perkins, and bassist Eric Avery. They released a live album in 1987, followed by two acclaimed studio albums, "Nothing's Shocking" and "Ritual de lo Habitual," which helped them gain commercial success and a cult following. Jane's Addiction has gone through multiple reunions and breakups, with different bass players joining at various points. In 2022, Avery rejoined the band, but due to health issues and a controversial incident, Navarro was replaced by other guitarists for some tours.
title: Jane's Addiction
